definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: I took on Phillip as my trainee.
sentences.chinese: 我同意让菲利浦做我的见习生。

sentences.english: Is there any discount if it is done by a trainee?
sentences.chinese: 要是一个见习生剪我发，可以打折吗？

sentences.english: Hi-tech companies need many interns to work for them during the summer.
sentences.chinese: 高科技公司在夏天需要许多见习生为其工作。

sentences.english: Phil was articled to a firm of lawyers.
sentences.chinese: 菲尔签约在一家律师事务所当见习生。

sentences.english: Bossuet will take a little turn in the court and talk with the young law licentiates .
sentences.chinese: 博须埃到法院去走一趟，和那些见习生谈谈。

sentences.english: He was rated as a midshipman.
sentences.chinese: 他被定为海军学校见习生的等级。

definition: to learn on the job/to be on probation
warrant officer/petty officer/noncommissioned officer (NCO)/Japanese military officer
to replace sb on a workshift/to substitute for
to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
to keep for use/to retain sth/to keep sb in his job
to accept a job offer/to apply for an advertised position
